life cambodians today would like to highlight remarkable organization is mak enormous contribution field of labor rights: solidarity center non-governmental organization (ngo) affiliate of american federation of labour (afl-cio) solidarity center programs over 60 countries around world work independent trade unions to promote workers rights to conduct labor law advocacy under leadership of canadian citizen david welsh solidarity center cambodia receiv praise high level of engagement important stakeholders includ royal government of cambodia international corporations unit nations international labor organization (ilo) various partners human labor rights ngo community over past decade of discussion trade unions labor rights minimum wage cambodia been relat to garment sector countrys top foreign currency earner industry greatly contribut to cambodias economic growth provid opportunities many cambodians to supplement incomes there major concerns salaries unsafe conditions overall treatment of workers solidarity center been deeply engag advocacy responses to other issues garment sector play significant role recent negotiations over minimum wage continue to work key reforms includ cambodia propos trade union law national social security fund seeks to broaden economic security of Cambodia workers solidarity center provides support to trade unions workers every major sector cambodia through train advocacy addition to garment sector includes construction hospitality tourism civil service education one of areas of emphasis is promot collective bargaining allows workers to negotiate management group giv leverage than would individuals recent years organization been forefront of legal proceedings involv welfare of workers help to establish government international brand industry liability several cases regard bankruptcy accidents fatalities earlier week u.s embassy host roundtable discussion members of u.s congressional delegation l house minority bulk of garment industry bound unit states cambodias strong economic growth would possible without valuable partnerships solidarity center establish Cambodia government garment buyers other stakeholders continu to work together solidarity center other organizations both public private sectors can improve work conditions encourage corporate social responsibility strengthen commercial ties step down february 1 2013 senator john f kerry been nominat to succe her click to watch u.s 7th fleet orient express band perform jason marz angeles university foundation philippines 7th fleet orient express band (feat aok sokunkanha) perform twin lions sihanouk ville cambodia december 4th 1950: unit states establishes diplomatic relations cambodia june 29 appointment of donald r heath envoy extraordinary minister plenipotentiary u.s legation opens phnom penh november 14 renown hotel le royal legation office u.s information service library later establish new location legation is rais to embassy status june 25 1952 point heath becomes first u.s ambassador to cambodia 1953: cambodia declares full independence france november 9 intense negotiations between k norodom sihanouk french governmentwith unit states often act mediator throughout talks unit states actively supports cambodias bid autonomy although france does fully cede authority over cambodia until geneva conference 1954 1955: unit states establishes assistance program cambodia budget of $50 million per year aid seeks to promote cambodias economic social progress improv expand public education build infrastructure moderniz arm forces among other activities aid program is larger size scope than combin support other countries international organizations unit states provid $493 million assistance 1963 1958: sihanouk abdicat throne 1955 took title of prince becomes first Cambodia head of state to visit unit states itinerary includes stops washington d.c. new york city detroit chicago los angeles princes visit causes stir diplomatic circles particularly follow cambodian-them parties organizes new york washington include traditional khmer dance recital royal Cambodia ballet dur talks president dwight d eisenhower prince presents 12th-century solid granite angkorian buddha still stands today washingtons national gallery 1959: cambodia unveils national highway four built $25 million of u.s assistance cambodia daily: voa - #cambodia economic impact of Cambodia agriculture - ambassador penh is well-known fact agriculture made profound impact economic growth of cambodia previous blog highlight sustainable climate resilient agriculture plays role poverty reduction employ over 50 percent of kingdoms population single part of economy agriculture accounts than 30 percent of cambodias gross domestic product thanks to pro-business regulatory framework average growth rate of seven percent per year over last decade cambodia is pois to see continu expansion of agribusiness relat sectors provide many great opportunities trade business country Cambodia rice is excellent example of value add to economy success of countrys farmers agricultural businesses Cambodia jasmine again honor best rice world is noteworthy achievement highlights quality of kingdoms agricultural products potential increas rice exports is excellent news ongo efforts to eradicate extreme poverty cambodia however rice is cambodias success story mango growers cambodia two crops year trees march april again october november double harvest unseen many other places gives cambodia edge provid delicious quality fruit - both domestic demand grow export market however mango industry other areas of cambodias agricultural sector continue to expand there certain issues present challenges future example capacity-build to promote increas productivity use of modern farm technology equipment would provide even greater benefits to cambodias agricultural sector thankfully cambodia partners to help develop solutions to challenges help send strong message to world country is ready to share continu success of agribusiness recently john deere chairman ceo sam allen other company executives visit cambodia show american companies recognize kingdoms potential future growth agribusiness giant manufacturing sale export of high-quality agricultural heavy equipment machinery john deeres visit to cambodia includ tour of rma cambodias phnom penh facility meet deputy prime minister sok is positive sign cambodias agriculture sector is expect to remain profitable years to come visit is symbol of strong trade relationship between unit states cambodia support of mutual economic benefit unit states remains committ to support cambodias economic growth includes success of agribusiness sector several u.s government initiatives partnerships fund through u.s agency international development (usaid) recognize challenges help thousands of farmers increase income meet grow demand products through us presidential initiative call fe future usaid programs respond introduc new varieties of rice help Cambodia farmers to diversify incomes different crops knowledge of seasonal rotation methods through improv agricultural practices new technologies usaids harvest program alone increas productivity income 44,450 smallholder rice farmers further contribut to success of cambodias award-winn rice sector strongly believe combin efforts of unit states Cambodia government civil society private sector importantly farmers of cambodia continue to shape agricultural sector lead to sustainable business model make better future at-risk women girls pok panhavichet executive director of Cambodia womens crisis center (cwcc) panhavichet born kandal province educat phnom penh many years she advocat rights of women girls hav work Cambodia government international development agencies local civil society cwcc found 1997 helps survivors of domestic violence rape human traffick recover suffer violence endured believe success of cwcc ensur protection of womens rights is best summ up motto: help women help themselves one of core functions of cwcc is to provide women children refuge support one of three shelters operate phnom penh siem reap banteay meanchey shelters provide temporary safe accommodation women children escap violence offers medical care counseling legal protection literacy vocational train skills reintegration classes another aspect of cwccs response to violence against women is legal assistance program aims to empower women to leave abusive exploitive situations to provide women legal advice support to hold perpetrators accountable violent criminal actions service is vital many of women poor to secure own legal representation human traffick is grow concern cambodia cwcc is there to assist women children return to homes communities organization establish program to reduce unsafe migration conduct campaigns raise awareness trafficking years cwcc been forefront of chang peoples attitudes violence against women partner government officials to provide train police officers local authorities to help recognize enforce laws protect rights of women children rural communities country nearly two decades of operations cwcc help almost 20,000 people escape suffer rebuild lives want to thank panhavichet her outstand leadership of cwcc her commitment to empower victims of violence human traffick cambodia to build better lives children #ambtodd #cambodia cwcc to read blog entries ambassador todd khmer translation to: blogs.usembassy.gov/todd usaid job open independence france november 9 intense negotiations between k norodom sihanouk french governmentwith unit states often act mediator throughout talks unit states actively supports cambodias bid autonomy although france does fully cede authority over cambodia until geneva conference 1954 1955: unit states establishes assistance program cambodia budget of $50 million per year aid seeks to promote cambodias economic social progress improv expand public education build infrastructure moderniz arm forces among other activities aid program is larger size scope than combin support other countries international organizations unit states provid $493 million assistance 1963 1958: sihanouk abdicat throne 1955 took title of prince becomes first Cambodia head of state to visit unit states letters pos u.s government attempt to extract payment dv applicants applicants encourag to read our fraud alert regard dv program here: no organization can send notification of selection dv program billion committ to fight hiv/aids (and malaria tuberculosis) of end of 2013 commitment to fight aids worldwide been continu president obama through pepfar other initiatives unit states ralli world fight against hiv aids unit states is far nation is tak hiv/aids fact one of world leaders fight against hiv/aids is cambodia is own observation opinion of global experts 2010 unit nations recogniz cambodia millennium development goal award outstand national leadership commitment progress reduc hiv prevalence than 50% achiev universal access to hiv/aids treatment 2013 expert panel review cambodias strategy hiv conclud country is track to eliminate new hiv infections 2020 would make cambodia first country world to achieve aids-free generation u.s government is proud to partner cambodia efforts to eliminate hiv/aids u.s embassy had own pepfar office 2006 draw resources of two outstand agencies: u.s agency international development (usaid) u.s centers disease control prevention (cdc) fact of our cdc staff co-locat ministry of health work side side many health initiatives pepfars efforts to combat hiv/aids cambodia take many forms one priority is to help to prevent new infections particular focus reduc transmission between mothers babies among populations highest risk of infection pepfar programs help to care individuals hiv-positive orphans left behind di result of aids pepfar helps to ensure hiv-positive cambodians receive high-quality treatment works to strengthen Cambodia health system to ensure capacity know-how to address needs of hiv/aids patients dur last year pepfar help cambodia provide treatment to almost 50,000 individuals directly provid hiv test to over 80,000 pregnant women pepfars integrat approach to reduc aids cambodia is model should duplicat many places possible people often ask me is really possible cambodia become first country to aids-free generation even unit states answer is yes long cambodia maintains commitment despite limit resources cambodia work strategically to address problem of hiv/aids ever first cases detect early 1990s cambodia is one of 12 countries worldwide been able to ensure universal access to hiv treatment (accord to world health organization global update treatment 2013) addition Cambodia government develop excellent cooperation international ngo civil society partners issue of hiv/aids congratulate ministry of health national center hiv/aids dermatology sexually transmitt infections (stis) leadership issue although progress is be made fight to defeat hiv/aids cambodia is far over estimat 75,000 adults children liv hiv cambodia there approximately 1,100 new infections every year many people still highly susceptible to hiv infection includ women men work sex industry drug abusers addition patients friends simply dr claire board certifi emergency medicine physician she complet three years of extraordinary service international sos clinic of phnom penh now she return to unit states train continue her career emergency medicine august 2012 dr claire serv de facto emergency room savior to members of our mission u.s military american tourists expat community cambodians well fact cambodians represent than 60 percent of patients she treat dur her time country her expertise car bedside manner relationship between doctor patient made huge difference lives of thousands of people dr claire always will to adjust her schedule to accommodate her patients even she busy other tasks she serv role model her peers like many other american doctors nurses dr claire came to cambodia due to her strong interest help people practic medicine abroad she made significant impact dur her time cambodia show commitment genuine passion car patients families routine illnesses well severe medical crises did she provide direct consultation treatment she able to reach people throughout country provid medical advice newspapers guide books online health resources dr claire play key role team international sos cambodia establish medical clinic phnom penh 1998 organization serv needs of public help both Cambodia doctors international physicians like dr claire clinic specializes number of areas includ general practice womens health dermatology internal medicine emergency medicine travel medicine dental care miss dr claire am confident team continue to provide quality services to people liv travel cambodia her advice to other health professionals dr claire says consciously seek opportunities to experience medicine clinical setting well volunteer home school community gett kind of experience. am personally grateful dr claire decid to serve cambodia of us interact work alongside her dur past three years please join me wish her best she pursues next chapter her life sincerely standards cambodia way run business past highlight examples of strong corporate social responsibility (csr) practices cambodia both good employees good business include ges contributions to support jewelry electronics supplies number of u.s companies such eyeglass manufacturer oakley dur tour learn pactics invest money to incorporate sustainable build measures energy sav technology design factory example windows north-fac to provide natural light reduc electricity usage minimiz heat-generat direct sunlight strategically plac vents create naturally cool workspace rainwater is collect to flush toilets solar panels power l lights us dark general manager boris ploum explain pactics efforts to minimize environmental impact may seem expensive actually reduces operat costs over long run Cambodia government can encourage use of green technologies provid incentives to companies invest technologies commend announcement of recent proposal environment minister samal to make eco-friendly green technologies tax-free to help reduce cost barriers associat import green technologies such solar panels tour factory meet workers appreciat than ever vision set pactics management to think beyond profits to broader contributions make to community company offers employees fair wages reasonable work hours safe clean work conditions subsidies motorbike helmets safe commute full array of other benefits aim to keep workers healthy companies such pactics demonstrate is possible to run successful business car employees environment encourage other companies cambodia to follow example set pactics to improve work conditions employees is right th to do is good business #ambtodd #cambodia to read entries ambassador todd blog to: blogs.usembassy.gov/todd photo: ambassador todd tour of challenges find good-pay jobs one reason is employers increasingly look to hire workers already demonstrat skills ne to perform young people enter work force possess right skills employers may overlook otherwise promis hir opportunities one way businesses governments organizations can help bridge gaps is through internships practice is widely us unit states strongly believe work experience young people gain through internship programs can serve catalyst professional success is why u.s embassy runs yearly summer internship program promis Cambodia university students conclud years internship program twelve interns gain valuable work experience areas of financial management consular affairs information technology human resources public affairs program management procurement extremely thankful meaningful contributions hope unique experience provide each of confidence skills open doors to opportunities order to further tap potential of cambodias bright students youth council partner american chamber of commerce to place highly qualifi students internship positions excellent companies youth council organiz internship workshops offer train resum writing prepar job interview office etiquette professional ethics than 300 young cambodians attend workshops than thirty internship candidates program been successfully plac twenty different companies cambodia unit states find many executives start off interns 1972 bill gates intern u.s house of representatives two years internship gates co-found microsoft one of worlds lead corporations steven spielberg intern becom global icon moviemaking deputy embassy state department intern enjoy experience l to her apply to become diplomat internships can should beneficial both to hir company to intern many cases hir managers want applicants offer very different gap between skills present skills requir can remedi provid on-the-job training join organization company intern provides student opportunity to work hands-on professional environment help employer evaluate student would fare actual workplace serves sort of test run both student employer interns valuable to employers many reasons addition to creat effective pathway hiring interns fill positions assist employers innovative ideas technology young motivat interns can add fresh perspectives ideas to increase organizational productivity giv students space to develop professionally hope employers continue to see value of hands-on internship programs design to mentor cultivate todays young leaders strengthen understand of job market prepare future available inspection september 17 8 a.m to 10 a.m general public may inspect lots place bids 10:15 a.m bids opened successful bidders 15 minutes to make full payment cash purchas merchandise must remov september 17 september 18 8 a.m to 5 p.m conditions of sale public sale (sealed-bid sale) property sold to bidder offer highest bid price merchandise offered property is sold as-is where-is non-returnable basis cash payment without refund warranty krangmeas computer reserves right to reject any bid is consider to commensurate value of property to reject any bid there is evidence of connivance collusion bribery successful bidders to make full payment cash to krangmeas computer cashier sale site remove merchandise purchas within four business days sale arrangements payment of cost necessary to effect removal of property responsibility of purchaser order to remove goods sale site must present sign receipt other documents issu krangmeas computer cashier show payment full well important legacy is mak bfcs findings available to public online database bfcs programs support workers educat labor law help better understand rights one example of bfc promotes workers rights is through use of mobile phone technologies kamako chhnoeum (outstand worker khmer) mobile phone project is interactive voice response system allows factory workers to call toll-free to take short quiz of workers factory management others work garment industry excellent record of bfc achievements there is no doubt jills efforts been instrumental assist Cambodia workers same time creat opportunities cambodians positions of management actively promotes employees two factories vital to success of cambodia garment industry generates over 80% of national export income managers of companies #ambheidt affects nearly 350 million people worldwide diabetes serious condition affects way body uses blood sugar is increasingly seen low middle-income countries like cambodia fortunately many cases of cambodia -from ambassador penh today live increasingly mobile world people ability to travel to different continent matter of hours however means diseases can cross borders oceans freely humans people of cambodia greatest asset healthy population is critical to countrys economic development keep everyone around world cambodia healthy requires international cooperation im proud u.s government is committ to help Cambodia people healthy future roughly one half of our development assistance cambodia is dedicat to health programs combatt diseases such malaria weve seen tremendous successes recent years our efforts to improve health of cambodians involve than development agencies last week lieutenant general patricia horoho u.s army surgeon general commander of u.s army medical command visit cambodia to assess u.s military research units country to discuss bilateral cooperation between unit states cambodia variety of health issues lieutenant general horoho is first woman first nurse to ever hold title of surgeon general 239-year history of u.s army along cambodia-thailand border north of siem reap lieutenant general horoho review bilateral malaria control activities of arm forces research institute of medical sciences (afrims) one of u.s armys premier research units royal Cambodia arm forces (rcaf) border area is currently home to strain of malaria resistant individuals to of powerful effective drugs available partnership cambodias national malaria center (nmc) rcaf afrims been work to build research capacity conduct high quality biomedical research cambodia to develop new drugs to fight spread of malaria phnom penh lieutenant general horoho tour laboratories of u.s naval medical research unit-2 detachment (namru-2) work nmc other government health offices to conduct research surveillance detection malaria other infectious diseases lieutenant general horoho met Cambodia health officials tour rcaf health science institute visit preah ket mealea army hospital dur her visit lieutenant general horoho took time to talk armys new wellness campaign performance triad is called emphasizes gett quality sleep engag activity improv nutrition tak steps to take care of ourselves can improve our health to able to lead productive long happy lives all say goes health is greatest wealth want to thank lieutenant general horoho her visit to highlight continu collaboration between unit states cambodia effort to improve health of Cambodia people partner rcaf cambodias government health sector u.s military complements efforts of other u.s government agencies kingdom to assist cambodians to lead healthy lives would like to recognize lieutenant general be excellent role model girls to pursue career fields of science technology engineering mathematics (stem) her rise to become u.s army surgeon general highest-rank position armys medical department is tribute to her hard work dedication hope girls young women especially cambodia consider career stem fields #ambtodd january 28 2015 to apply information click here: preserv history phnom kulen - ambassador penh cambodia is known around world amaz cultural patrimony archaeological sites to traditional folklore to apsara dance u.s government is proud supporter of cultural heritage cambodia particularly through ambassadors fund cultural preservation program (afcp) 2001 cambodia receiv 16 afcp grants total than $2.3 million puts second place worldwide (after afghanistan) is testament to cambodias extraordinary cultural heritage to many great partners work with includ ministry of culture fine arts unesco many cultural institutions ngos one of our recent afcp projects is mapping documentation preservation of angkorian sites phnom kulen project is be carri archaeology development foundation (adf) cooperation apsara national authority ministry of environment project is l dr jean-baptiste chevance is work amazingly talent team of Cambodia archaeologists workers phnom kulen is sandstone plateau locat 40 kilometers northeast of angkor archaeological park siem reap town been consider sacr least thousand years phnom kulen is famous today preah ang thom pagoda reclin buddha area remain largely unexplor long period of time contains myriad of significant archaeological remnants sculpt riverbeds caves to ancient waterworks temples 2008 adf been carry systematic archaeological study mapp project 2012 adf began to use airborne laser scann technology call lidar help of university of sydney us lidar adf able to uncover unprecedent urban network confirm existence of mahendraparvata renown capital of jayavarman ii dates to 9th century u.s governments afcp grant help adf to complete inventory of previously unknown features to protect sites destructive agricultural practices addition to preserv cultural heritage afcp programs help to build local expertise thanks to phnom kulen project adf been able to train five Cambodia archaeologists ground survey techniques use of lidar global position satellites Cambodia staff play crucial role build awareness local residents work is be done supports communities ongo challenge conservationists face phnom kulen (and elsewhere) is threat of deforestation phnom kulen national park 20 percent of original forest cover remains of rest been turn cashew nut plantations damages environment destroys important archaeological evidence illegal logg is continu challenge to conservation efforts consider phnom kulens cultural scientific value is essential look solutions to protect resource includ alternative agricultural practices tourism development am extremely proud u.s government is play important role study preservation of phnom kulen look forward to support new cultural preservation projects years to come photo: adf archaeologist william e todd #ambtodd position: financial management analyst annual salary range: usd 12,116 18,785 clos date: may 23 2013 information: qualifications required: * bachelors degree accounting finance economics business administration is required * least three years progressive work experience budget financial management within international organizations non-governmental organizations other governmental institutions * level iv (fluent) speaking/reading/writ english khmer required language proficiency tested * must able to relate financial activities (e.g. obligations liquidations strip coding etc.) to financial plans budget requirements out-year * must able to work effectively work under pressure work team must excellent administrative mathematic analytical skills good interpersonal communication skills good attention to details skills formulating monitor report budgets * must able to operate various computer applications software president obama: "...the people of libya show universal pursuit of dignity freedom is far stronger than iron fist of dictator... click link below to read president obama statement latest events libya: today is world day of social justice is day health projects volunteers work students families communities serve to empower young women to find solutions allow girls to stay school first lady of unit states michelle obama visit cambodia two weeks ago she deliver speech to very first let girls learn workshop peace corps volunteers local leaders educators students work with mrs obama workshop participants youre embodiment of let girls learn is about really peace corps volunteers community leaders parents girls work side-by-side to help girls to school and importantly stay school eventually peace corps conduct girls education workshops of nearly 7,000 volunteers tens of thousands of community leaders countries work in support of let girls learn initiative peace corps is promot help fundrais efforts girls empowerment programs such camp glow (girls lead our world) camps held world every peace corps country design to encourage young women to become active citizens promot gender equality develop leadership skills improv self-esteem increas knowledge of womens health issues support aspirations career goals camps offer adolescent girls self-development opportunities fun friendly atmosphere instill each young woman belief she can make difference her community country cambodia than 2,400 Cambodia students participat glow camps workshops conduct peace corps volunteers last year last weekend eight volunteers counterparts organiz three-day glow camp prey veng 64 girls prey veng svay rieng camp provid safe space girls learn general reproductive health dangers of human trafficking healthy relationships domestic violence girls learn resume writing attend college apply scholarships workshop design help prepare future opportunities another six camps held cambodia may june of year want to thank of our strategy four goals mind number one to control outbreak number two to address ripple effects of local economies communities to prevent truly massive humanitarian disaster number three to sihanouk proclaims seven-day national holiday country erupts mass celebrations 1965: conflict escalat vietnam border incursions eastern cambodia increase result civilian casualties prince sihanouk fears countrys territorial integrity seeks assurances both unit states communist governments political power is further threaten dissident groups meanwhile unit states claims Cambodia military is cooperat viet cong forces unable to resolve grievances unit states cambodia officially sever diplomatic ties may relations restor until end of decade 1967: jacqueline kennedy visits cambodia november lifelong dream of visit angkor wat she is first american to receiv high state honors ties broken signal promis turn relationship 1969: president richard m nixon orders covert bomb campaign of eastern cambodia operation menu lasts 14 months results release of 2,756,941 tons of ordnance nixon authorizes bombings attempt to thwart viet cong forces 1970 occupy between fifth third of Cambodia territory campaign does become known to american public until 1973 1969: diplomatic relations restored u.s embassy reopens august 16 lloyd m rives act charg daffaires ad interim staff of eight later month 4th message ambassador heidt (as seen phnom penh post) november 8 american people come together to select new president of unit states along thousands of other federal state local ofcials years election is shap up to one of hotly contest our history strong views both sides despite rhetoric passion of election no matter wins fundamental principles of our democracy remain intact winners celebrate losers concede decision of american people respected been than two centuries candidates political parties put election behind them winners business of governing losers start gett ready next election there is than one recipe democracy works unit states may necessarily work cambodia any democracy political forces must share basic acceptance opponents legitimate right to engage politics politicians sides may agree issues even like each other must accept opponents right to advocate interests treat accordingly gotten to many of leaders of government opposition return to cambodia nine months ago large good patriotic people try to best cambodia neither side seems to accept other legitimate little than year culture of dialogue announced again see little respect polite discourse contemporary Cambodia politics comes to accept right of opponent to pursue interests essence of reconciliation feel sadden to there been little progress either side previous assignment late 1990s Cambodia democracy is go to endure Cambodia people clearly want politicians sides ne to separate political personal ne to understand two sides can disagree direction of nation shar love country citizens institutions need all to recognize good each other there is fundamental difference between disagree opponent consider him her to enemy politicians unit states radically different points of view every issue imaginable our best politicians our statesmen stateswomen respect opponents right to pursue interests compete elections call each other traitors challeng each others patriotism cheapen our politics honesty always been way early part of our history our politicians often engag stghts worse took many years of bitter politics to realize counter-productive to interests interests of nation arriv cambodia u.s ambassador last september been amaz progress country made 1990s economy is booming infra-structure is developed people healthier educated civil society is stronger cambodias youth optimistic proud of country eager to participate shap future cambodia overcome many obstacles over years inability of cambodias political leaders to work each other benet of nation continues to prevent great country reach full potential july 4 celebrate 240th anniversary of independence of unit states of america been through many ups downs over years over time our democracy surviv ourished work of democracy is never nished mak progress friend of cambodia is earnest hope both government opposition can reach to each other spirit of patriotism reconciliation to same khmer new year": seek individual public affairs specialist position info: qualifications required: * bachelors degree liberal arts education social sciences international relations is required * three years of progressively responsible experience field of public affairs cultural activities university teach is required * must expert knowledge of Cambodia cultural educational social economic political structure institutions political parties cultural movements historical development key figures mass media military government cultural educational circles * must ability to develop maintain extensive high level contacts cultural governmental educational circles ability to plan arrange execute one major segments of overall cultural program ambassador todd: "decades of conflict end 1990s to purchase products without worry time distance help to develop cambodians expertise comfort utiliz technology innovative ways maio mall is great example of e-commerce term any type of business us internet to exchange goods services unit states e-commerce platforms like amazon ebay simplifi americans way of life lett consumers purchase products online yet e-commerce doesnt benefits consumers increases business opportunities encourages healthy business competition leads to stronger economy cambodia online businesses marketplaces like kaymu snappyshop already show budd entrepreneurs can enter market us low-cost user-friendly platform to connect potential consumers companies like maio mall develop business models to better understand provide Cambodia consumers want faster delivery of goods services to systems allow to purchase items us multiple forms of payment arrival of e-commerce market is one development cambodias economic evolution fact there already many prominent Cambodia businesses us facebook other mobile applications to serve customers regardless of size of business success of online ventures benefits cambodias economy people however creat strong e-commerce sector does happen overnight e-commerce requires pro-business environment protects intellectual property consumer rights makes easier to facilitate payment delivery of products Cambodia government already one of pro-business regulatory frameworks region is currently work legislation to support regulate e-commerce effective government policies lead to partnerships international companies such paypal provid consumers safe mechanisms to pay products online allow businesses to earn both trust capital ne to expand ventures increas presence of entrepreneurs cambodia e-commerce can vehicle economic states 1950s runs phnom penh to countrys deep-water port sihanoukville 1992: un transition authority cambodia (untac) takes over administration of cambodia u.s assistance pays 30% of untacs budget 15 warmest years record occurr century closer to home researchers expect cambodia experience increases average temperature longer warmer dry season rainfall dur wet season variation weather includes recent cold snap experienc over past month here temperatures dropp to low teens areas government advis people to bundle up warmer cloth preventive measure against colds influenza other respiratory illnesses associat cold weather of variations result of climate change phnom penh travel to other parts of country seen cambodians deal effects of climate change experienc of coolest temperatures felt time cambodia however different day different part of country br large amounts of dust dry temperatures along hav impact our individual sense of comfort cloth preferences changes noticeable effect cambodias important resources last week had opportunity to visit number of rural areas cambodia approximately 80 percent of population lives people met rely agriculture fisheries forestry livelihoods agriculture particular is one of pillars to cambodias economic growth however scientists economists note countrys vulnerability to climate change can lead to lower agricultural output greater food insecurity millions of cambodians shifts rainfall flood patterns result climate change threaten traditional agricultural production accounts 85 percent of rice production country visit cardamom mountains largest tropical moist broadleaf forest southeast asia home to vast population of plant animal life can already see huge impact climate change is hav area add to damage been caus cutt down many trees changes cambodias weather start to create problems trees rainforest continu loss of trees result limit food security dust storms droughts record flood throughout year extreme temperatures can especially dangerous newly releas maps help show cambodia continues to suffer major deforestation loss of forest cover magnifies impact of climate change alter water supply lead to intensifi floods droughts is important to remember cambodias precious forests provide livelihoods many cambodians forests ability to hold carbon helps reduce greenhouse gas emissions entire world further help to combat global climate change several u.s government initiatives help cambodias farmers adapt to challenges caus chang weather patterns cambodia harvest integrat food security climate change program is help thousands of farmers increase income improve food security adapt to consequences of climate change part of work rice farmers harvest introduc flood- drought-tolerant se varieties allow farmers to delay accelerate plant to unpredictable weather conditions visit several harvest-support farms been gratify to see program helps farmers families boost standard of liv even crop production state of go team cambodia -from ambassador penh am firm believer society benefits every member is able to lead full meaningful lives however many individuals disabilities around world unable to thrive of discrimination stigma encounter people intellectual disability (id) particular been largely misunderstood individuals id certain limitations cognitive function skills includ communication social self-care skills limitations can cause child to develop learn slowly differently than typically develop child common causes of id genetic conditions complications dur pregnancy birth diseases toxic exposure individuals cause of id is unknown is known is individuals id often face barriers prevent fully participat community thats why pleas to see two events over past weekend highlight chang attitudes acceptance of individuals id saturday open ceremony of special olympics world games held los angeles california sunday unit states mark 25th anniversary of americans disabilities act law ensures equal rights to persons disabilities prohibits discrimination areas of public life found eunice kennedy shriver special olympics is organization changes lives advances human dignity through sport special olympics provide sports train athletic competition children adults intellectual disability giv opportunities to develop physical fitness demonstrate courage experience joy bill worlds largest sports humanitarian event people id been showcas athletic abilities to world first special olympics 1968 back then thousand people 26 u.s states canada gather chicago illinois to compete track field swimming floor hockey week 6,500 athletes 2,000 coaches represent 165 countries participate 25 sports biggest athletic gather los angeles 1984 olympics third time cambodia compet special treatment many people country remain high risk of hiv infection however is critical to continue to expand reach of hiv services health information to hard-to-reach groups thats why am excit yesterdays release of innovative tool to help fight against new hiv infections cambodia mobile health platform call mhealth launch week usaids cambodia hiv/aids flagship project collaboration national aids authority ministry of posts telecommunications cambodia hiv/aids flagship project is consortium of local international non-governmental organizations (ngos) fund u.s presidents emergency plan aids relief (pepfar) through u.s agency international development (usaid) mhealth platform is example of u.s government partners royal government of cambodia ngos to provide potentially life-sav hiv-relat information services to underserv populations includ entertainment workers previous blog mention mobile phones can help improve lives of people provid access to information mhealth platform is example of mobile phone technology be us to help at-risk populations receive access to hiv information services need mhealth platform features voice4u mobile phone interactive voice response system provides callers on-line counseling on-demand hiv health-relat information medication appointment reminders another component of mhealth is community set of interactive websites facebook pages offers electronically-mapp service locations downloadable referrals hiv relat news information individual risk screening more cambodias achievements prevent treat hiv testament to strong leadership strategic direction of ministry of health other key government agencies well to support of ngo development partners unit states is proud to support cambodia continues to work towards goal of eliminat new hiv
